content:
All the music streaming services I mentioned offer a free trial or a free version with limited features. Here's a breakdown:

1. **Tidal**: Tidal offers a 30-day free trial for new users. You can try out their HiFi plan, which includes Hi-Res Audio, during this period. After the trial, you can decide to subscribe to their HiFi plan ($19.99/month) or their Premium plan ($9.99/month, which is similar to other standard music streaming services).
2. **Amazon Music HD**: Amazon offers a 30-day free trial for their Music HD service. You can try out their High Definition audio tier, which includes Hi-Res Audio, during this period. After the trial, you can subscribe to their Music HD plan ($14.99/month or $12.99/month for Prime members).
3. **Deezer HiFi**: Deezer offers a 30-day free trial for their HiFi plan, which includes lossless audio (FLAC, 1411 kbps). After the trial, you can subscribe to their HiFi plan ($14.99/month).
4. **Qobuz**: Qobuz offers a 30-day free trial for their Hi-Res Audio service. You can try out their Studio Premier plan, which includes Hi-Res Audio, during this period. After the trial, you can subscribe to their Studio Premier plan ($14.99/month or $149.99/year).
5. **Apple Music**: Apple Music offers a 3-month free trial for new users. While it doesn't specifically offer Hi-Res Audio, you can still try out their service and see if you like it. After the trial, you can subscribe to their individual plan ($9.99/month).

All of these services allow you to cancel or change your plan at any time, so you can try them out risk-free.

Before committing to a paid plan, I recommend taking advantage of the free trials to:

* Test the audio quality and see if you can notice a difference
* Explore the music library and discover new artists
* Get familiar with the user interface and features
* Decide which service best fits your music listening habits and budget

Take your time, and enjoy the trials!
